pull.title: [rpc] ParseHash: Fail when length is not 64
pull.body:
There have been a few complaints such as  #9040... Maybe this helps to debug them further.

Of course this also makes it impossible to discard the "leading" zeros:

Before:

```
> getrawtransaction f3fe5b5c0024dbb1030edd720fc1effc306a054da5a507903e8cb5663336
< 01000000014f7...
```

After:

```
> getrawtransaction f3fe5b5c0024dbb1030edd720fc1effc306a054da5a507903e8cb5663336
< parameter 1 must be of length 64 (not 60) (code -8)
```

issue.title: rpc: ParseHash: Fail when length is not 64
issue.body:
SHA256 hashes should always be 64 characters.

Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9042

comments.body: `256 / 4` is more confusing than `32 * 2` or just `64`...
